People asking how lanes are drawn. Typically, athletes are seeded 1-8 based on time/place from semi-finals. 1-4 seeds random draw for lanes 3,4,5,6. 5-8 seeds random draw for lanes 1,2,7,8.

If you want a masterclass in applied sports psychology, watch high jumpers at the World champs.

Pre-jump you'll see the power of routines and visualization.

Post-jump you'll see evaluation & processing strategies, as well as how to let go, and refocus on the next jump.

Don't believe me? 

Lots of research here. It's a BS rule. You literally can't distinguish that 0.099 is impossible to react but 0.10 is possible.

It's completely arbitrary. 

Here's one study: https://t.co/rTfX8lH3CP

And an easy-to-read summary: https://t.co/QGHPfTX2BC

You can't give Allen a FS for a .099 reaction time.

0.10 is an arbitrary standard. 

There's no science behind 0.10 being fine and 0.099 being impossible.

It's BS. He should be allowed to run.

Reaction times: 0.1 limit is a convention since late 1960s and the first recordings in competitions by Junghans in West Germany, not a scientific finding at all. Here’s the history of RT & how IAAF came up with this number cemented in the 1991 rule :

https://t.co/VddClyDKdZ https://t.co/ojqS5jEvLr https://t.co/bjIDgyULaQ

The world leader at the 110m hurdles, competing at his home track for the World Championships only weeks after his dad passed away, is disqualified from the 110m hurdles for a technicality by reacting one thousandth of a second faster than allowed. What a travesty for this sport.
Emmanuel knew I wasn’t playing when he heard his government name 😅 https://t.co/mBNdDKEWA0

Another huge night for the Americans in Eugene. 1-2 for Grant Holloway and Trey Cunningham in the 110 hurdles, 1-2-3 by Crouser, Kovacs, & Awotunde in shot put, 1-2 for Nageotte & Morris in the pole vault. 

And yet I can’t stop thinking about the Devon Allen DQ.

Quote from Kaylee
“So Devon is DQ’d with a computer over 0.001. But in shot, we shove the stick where we roughly think it landed??” Track is so frustrating
